first_reading.text:
[[Is 58,9b]]Thus says the LORD: If you remove from your midst oppression, false accusation and malicious speech;
[[Is 58,10]]If you bestow your bread on the hungry and satisfy the afflicted; Then light shall rise for you in the darkness, and the gloom shall become for you like midday.
[[Is 58,11]]Then the LORD will guide you always and give you plenty even on the parched land. He will renew your strength, and you shall be like a watered garden, like a spring whose water never fails.
[[Is 58,12]]The ancient ruins shall be rebuilt for your sake, and the foundations from ages past you shall raise up; "Repairer of the breach," they shall call you, "Restorer of ruined homesteads."
[[Is 58,13]]If you hold back your foot on the sabbath from following your own pursuits on my holy day; If you call the sabbath a delight, and the LORD'S holy day honorable; If you honor it by not following your ways, seeking your own interests, or speaking with malice--
[[Is 58,14]]Then you shall delight in the LORD, and I will make you ride on the heights of the earth; I will nourish you with the heritage of Jacob, your father, for the mouth of the LORD has spoken.
first_reading.title: Book of Isaiah

psalm.text:
[[Ps 86,1]]Incline your ear, O LORD; answer me, 
for I am afflicted and poor.
[[Ps 86,2]]Keep my life, for I am devoted to you; 
save your servant who trusts in you.
[[Ps 86,3]]You are my God. 

Have mercy on me, O Lord, 
for to you I call all the day.
[[Ps 86,4]]Gladden the soul of your servant, 
for to you, O Lord, I lift up my soul.

[[Ps 86,5]]For you, O Lord, are good and forgiving, 
abounding in kindness to all who call upon you.
[[Ps 86,6]]Hearken, O LORD, to my prayer 
and attend to the sound of my pleading.
psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.text:
[[Lc 5,27]]Jesus saw a tax collector named Levi sitting at the customs post. He said to him, "Follow me."
[[Lc 5,28]]And leaving everything behind, he got up and followed him.
[[Lc 5,29]]Then Levi gave a great banquet for him in his house, and a large crowd of tax collectors and others were at table with them.
[[Lc 5,30]]The Pharisees and their scribes complained to his disciples, saying, "Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?"
[[Lc 5,31]]Jesus said to them in reply, "Those who are healthy do not need a physician, but the sick do.
[[Lc 5,32]]I have not come to call the righteous to repentance but sinners."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
